intro: Cestichis ovalis, commonly known as the oval cestichis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
